amendment.description: To establish consideration of the conditions relating to religious freedom of parties to trade negotiations as an overall negotiating objective of the United States.

action.text: Amendment SA 1237 as modified, under the order of 5/14/15, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 92 - 0. Record Vote Number: 182.

Amendment SA 1237 proposed by Senator Hatch for Senator Lankford to Amendment SA 1221. (consideration: CR S2926; text: CR S2926) To establish consideration of the conditions relating to religious freedom of parties to trade negotiations as an overall negotiating objective of the United States.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1237 proposed by Senator Hatch for Senator Lankford to Amendment SA 1221.

Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 1237 as modified, under the order of 5/14/15, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 92 - 0. Record Vote Number: 182.

Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 1237 as modified, under the order of 5/14/15, having achieved 60 votes in the affirmative, was agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 92 - 0. Record Vote Number: 182.
